p: In our work, we used over 4,000 mosquito images in this preliminary study of the use of CNN's for the identification of mosquitoes; with such a small sample size, we achieved an accuracy of 76.2% in the automatic recognition of species and gender for six classes of mosquito. However, it is very promising that we were able to distinguish Aedes mosquitoes from other mosquitoes correctly. Our method was able to achieve 100% accuracy in classifying between Aedes and Culex, although Culex was misclassified as Aedes 10% of the time during the test phase. In the recognition of the Aedes female, which is the most important vector of arboviruses, we achieved 82% accuracy. It is essential to understand that it is a training process and every time we add a new species further training of the network will be necessary.
